summary: This document appears to be a record or status report for a PIV (Personal Identity Verification) credential issued by the Department of Justice. It details the card's issuance, expiration dates, and sponsorship information, including the name of the current sponsor.

persons.name: Mercedes Idetta Beckett Simmons
persons.context: Listed as the 'Current Sponsor' for the PIV credential within the Bureau of Prisons/Federal Prison System. The document shows their Person ID and that they sponsored the credential.

events.title: PIV Card First Issued
events.description: The PIV credential was first issued to the cardholder.

events.title: Original Sponsorship Date
events.description: The original date when sponsorship for the PIV credential was established.

events.title: Sponsorship Last Updated
events.description: The sponsorship record for the PIV credential was last updated.

keyFacts: The document is a PIV credential record from the Department of Justice, linked to the Federal Prison System.
Mercedes Idetta Beckett Simmons is identified as the current sponsor for the credential holder.
The credential was first issued on March 11, 2015, and its PIV Auth Certificate expired on July 17, 2022.
The shipping address for the credential is associated with the DOJ at 150 Park Row.
The document appears to be an administrative record, not directly related to criminal allegations against Jeffrey Epstein.
